messages: 7f54a9a7a45500e05d81c1f9eb1c89c1 (02:00): not sure a cardbus compliant card works in a pcmcia though
8c645e7272fbea132a450898e595945b (02:00): ph00:13.0 CardBus bridge: Toshiba America Info Systems ToPIC97 (rev 20)
8c645e7272fbea132a450898e595945b (02:00): doesn't this information say it is a cardbus?
8c645e7272fbea132a450898e595945b (02:00): which i got from lspci

58daededdfa9ad0f3073d0a2edd86bad (02:00): num000: I have one of each here, and the guide on the left in side of the card is considerably thicker on the cardbus than the pcmcia, which prevents it going all the way in to a pcmcia slot
eb52568c86fddffada35118971431e5d (02:00): num000: meh, lspci's database might be incorrect.
8c645e7272fbea132a450898e595945b (02:01): so does it mean it is a 32-bit pcmcia host, where i can drive 32-bit cardbus
4254b29d664a79df391e68a0c28e4008 (02:01): jelly-home: it won't be incorrect about the device class ("CardBus bridge").
4254b29d664a79df391e68a0c28e4008 (02:01): num000: that's the idea, yes

305e8d2eb7fca5acb47d56f64c5d1a8f (02:06): hello
305e8d2eb7fca5acb47d56f64c5d1a8f (02:06): I am trying to install mozilla in debian etch
305e8d2eb7fca5acb47d56f64c5d1a8f (02:07): through synaptic
7f54a9a7a45500e05d81c1f9eb1c89c1 (02:07): num000: http://www.pcmcia.org/faq.htm has some information
305e8d2eb7fca5acb47d56f64c5d1a8f (02:07): but there is no SSL available
7f54a9a7a45500e05d81c1f9eb1c89c1 (02:07): have to go to bed though :) good luck
8b5a676617b109dd2d9d7f57f1c141a4 (02:07): jariep1_: tried links2 yet?
8b5a676617b109dd2d9d7f57f1c141a4 (02:07): it can do ssl, javascript, and graphics rendering (even without X)
8c645e7272fbea132a450898e595945b (02:07): Gathond thank you very much, this is really a help. nothing is better than documentation.
305e8d2eb7fca5acb47d56f64c5d1a8f (02:07): tarzeau, Mozilla was installed through debian, without PSM module for SSL
8b5a676617b109dd2d9d7f57f1c141a4 (02:08): jariep1_: by default? i doubt
305e8d2eb7fca5acb47d56f64c5d1a8f (02:08): through synaptic from the etch repositories
305e8d2eb7fca5acb47d56f64c5d1a8f (02:08): yes
8b5a676617b109dd2d9d7f57f1c141a4 (02:08): jariep1_: no debian doesn't install mozilla if you don't ask it to
8b5a676617b109dd2d9d7f57f1c141a4 (02:08): jariep1_: it installs alot of crap, but no, NOT mozilla
305e8d2eb7fca5acb47d56f64c5d1a8f (02:08): I know, I installed it from etch repositories
305e8d2eb7fca5acb47d56f64c5d1a8f (02:09): but itinstalled mozilla without ssl and the PSM module for it
8b5a676617b109dd2d9d7f57f1c141a4 (02:09): jariep1_: you have to ask to install it
305e8d2eb7fca5acb47d56f64c5d1a8f (02:09): but under Debian stable sarge, it doesn't do this
8b5a676617b109dd2d9d7f57f1c141a4 (02:09): jariep1_: yes it does
305e8d2eb7fca5acb47d56f64c5d1a8f (02:10): I ran debian sarge a couple months ago and always ran SSL sites
8b5a676617b109dd2d9d7f57f1c141a4 (02:10): jariep1_: true mozilla depends on mozilla-psm
8b5a676617b109dd2d9d7f57f1c141a4 (02:10): jariep1_: but wait, i've got sid here
305e8d2eb7fca5acb47d56f64c5d1a8f (02:10): ok
8b5a676617b109dd2d9d7f57f1c141a4 (02:10): jariep1_: sarge depends on it too
8b5a676617b109dd2d9d7f57f1c141a4 (02:10): jariep1_: maybe etch mozilla broke? (albeit i doubt , the dependency got changed)
0a728af393877e0435f8bb86e628dcd0 (02:10): apt-cache show mozilla-psm?
305e8d2eb7fca5acb47d56f64c5d1a8f (02:11): ok
305e8d2eb7fca5acb47d56f64c5d1a8f (02:11): how do I i nstall the PSM module without compiling Mozilla?
0a728af393877e0435f8bb86e628dcd0 (02:13): man apt-get  -- and man apt-cache for searching for which package you need
e90c8e1edb39b713d0675837a44d40d7 (02:14): hey, how to i convert a jpeg to pdf?
1007f859220c71def1def3d47098a9a4 (02:15): gpm: The GIMP perhaps, or OpenOffice.org
a3f00b93284464c5813b9722de5ab16e (02:15): gpm: for a command line solution try imagemagick
1007f859220c71def1def3d47098a9a4 (02:15): k_ismay: Can it output to pdf? I didn't know that..
305e8d2eb7fca5acb47d56f64c5d1a8f (02:15): enouf, thanks, I didn't realize it was so easy
0a728af393877e0435f8bb86e628dcd0 (02:16): jariep1: welcome  ..or learn aptitude -> man aptitude
305e8d2eb7fca5acb47d56f64c5d1a8f (02:16): I guess I have never installed mozilla without SSL support before
e90c8e1edb39b713d0675837a44d40d7 (02:16): k_ismay: haha, i assumed i'd installed that...no wonder. thanks
a3f00b93284464c5813b9722de5ab16e (02:16): beardy: actually I don't know. I misread pdf as png
0a728af393877e0435f8bb86e628dcd0 (02:17): jariep1: I adore the package mgmt abitlity/capabilties of Debian
a3f00b93284464c5813b9722de5ab16e (02:17): just tried it, it will convert to pdf.
1007f859220c71def1def3d47098a9a4 (02:18): k_ismay: Great.
e90c8e1edb39b713d0675837a44d40d7 (02:19): k_ismay: yeah, convert img.jpg pdf.pdf does the job

e90c8e1edb39b713d0675837a44d40d7 (02:20): echo "command"

e90c8e1edb39b713d0675837a44d40d7 (02:20): thanks k_ismay
c18cf7a879dce91bab5ee266a9140002 (02:20): i'm thinking about moving back to debian from ubuntu
c18cf7a879dce91bab5ee266a9140002 (02:21): should I use testing or unstable? (i want new packages like ubuntu has, but I don't like the idea of running an unstable" dist)
85df48809cb55476fac43aca572fedc4 (02:21): I meant more automatically, so I don't have to write every command twice and then keep it all in sync

1007f859220c71def1def3d47098a9a4 (02:21): dpkg: jpg2pdf is <reply> To get a .jpg into a .pdf, use imagemagick, or OpenOffice.org, or The GIMP (though it can only output to postscript, so you have to use ps2pdf too)
0efe2b90deb00e1c60a865c6a2df9958 (02:21): okay, beardy
1007f859220c71def1def3d47098a9a4 (02:22): zenwryly: Yes, 'man bash', it's there.
